xxl.core.spatial.cursors

Class Replicator.MaxSplitBit

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.predicates.AbstractPredicate
      • xxl.core.spatial.cursors.Replicator.Split
        • xxl.core.spatial.cursors.Replicator.MaxSplitBit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Predicate
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Replicator.MaxSplitLevel
    Enclosing class:
    Replicator

    public static class Replicator.MaxSplitBit
extends Replicator.Split
    Allows splits if the actual bitIndex is greater or equal than a given bound.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MaxSplitBit

        public MaxSplitBit(int bound)
        Creates a new MaxSplitBit-Predicate.
        Parameters:
        bound - max-split-bit for which a split is allowed, bound in [62,...,1]

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public boolean invoke(Object object)
        Description copied from class: AbstractPredicate
        Returns the result of the predicate as a primitive boolean value. This method calls the invoke method working on lists with a list containing the given argument (see below). This means, that the user has to override this method to create a predicate with one argument. The following listing shows the exact implementation of this method: 
             return invoke(Arrays.asList(argument));
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface Predicate
        Overrides:
        invoke in class AbstractPredicate
        Parameters:
        object - The object for which a split might be performed
        Returns:
        true if a split is performed
